channel.title: Can't connect to server?

item.title: Can't connect to server?
item.dc:creator: @Foundationrepair Foundationrepair
item.description:
@Foundationrepair wrote:

I managed to actually connect in the end. But the lines of text you want me to find are not in the client or gui

Is it possible to add these lines of text in?

Read full topic

item.title: Can't connect to server?
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

you was editing in the wrong spot that was where you would put a website link… search for this

public static String server = in your client folder client.java or gui.java & change whatever is there to 127.0.0.1 then compile. Also, without a router their is probably no way for your friends to connect unless you try like utorrent or hamachi.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't connect to server?
item.dc:creator: @Foundationrepair Foundationrepair
item.description:
@Foundationrepair wrote:

Hello, I was not sure if I am posting in the correct area. But I do believe that I have a client problem.
If this proves to be incorrect, then I am sorry for spamming this forum area and will abandon this thread.

But here is what is happening.

I have found a base, managed to do some editting and I wish to see if I am able to bring friends into the server to try out some of the changes that I have made.

I understand that inorder for others to join the game, I need to change the IP settings in the client.java or gui.java for the compiler, to my own.

I assume this is what I am meant to alter.

public URL getCodeBase() { if(signlink.mainapp != null) return signlink.mainapp.getCodeBase(); try { return new URL("http://my ip in here:" + (43676)); }

So I alter is accordingly, compile, but when I try to log into the server… I recieve “error connecting to server.”

I understand that portforwarding is required if one is using a router, but I am not(at this moment). I have a usb device to get connected, which I am using the IP address from. I know that ip addresses change from time to time. But that should not stop it from connecting at this moment(or so I think).

Can anyone shed any light on this?

Read full topic
